page.title: 08NORFOLK RURAL LIFE MUSEUM
page.content: The Norfolk Rural Life Museum , Gressenhall, was opened in 1976 in Beech House, a large building originally used as a workhouse and subsequently as an old people's home. It houses rural collections from the whole county. The main display hall deals with the history of agriculture in Norfolk. There are also displays on dairying,ironfoundery,education,shoe making and other rural industries. A "Craftmen's Row"in the out buildings includes reconstructions of workshops of a saddler,blacksmith, baker, basket maker and a wheelwright. Other exhibits include Cherry Tree Cottage- a typical Norfolk home c.1900 and a reconstructed village grocers shop. A c.1900 farm is being established adjacent to the museum.
